A multiplicative factor to death rate to: A multiplicative factor to death rate to patients that require but do not have access to an ICU bed relative to those who do.
Amplitude of seasonal variation in trans: Amplitude of seasonal variation in transmission
Assumptions on severity which are inform: Assumptions on severity which are informed by epidemiological and clinical observations in China
Average number of days a critical case s: Average number of days a critical case stays in the ICU
Average number of days a person is infec: Average number of days a person is infectious. Over this time, R0 infections happen on average. Together with the latency time, this defines the serial interval. The longer the serial interval, the slower the outbreak.
Average number of days a severe case sta: Average number of days a severe case stays in regular hospital beds
Average number of secondary infections p: Average number of secondary infections per case. When R0 varies throughout the year (seasonal forcing), this value is the mean R0.
Combination of population, epidemiology,: Combination of population, epidemiology, and mitigation scenarios
Country to determine the Age distributio: Country to determine the age distribution in the population
Csv file could not be parsed: CSV file could not be parsed
Drag black dots with the mouse to simula: Drag black dots with the mouse to simulate how infection control affects the outbreak trajectory. One is no infection control, zero is complete prevention of all transmission.
Drag n drop some files here, or click to: Drag n' drop some files here, or click to select files
Epidemiological parameters specifing gro: Epidemiological parameters specifing growth rate, seasonal variation, and duration of hospital stay. The presets are combinations of speed and geography (speed/region).
No such country in our data: No such country in our data
Number of cases imported from the outsid: Number of cases imported from the outside per day on average
Number of cases present at the start of: Number of cases present at the start of simulation
Number of controllable points on the mit: Number of controllable points on the mitigation curve
Number of hospital beds available in hea: Number of hospital beds available in health care system. Presets are rough estimates indicating total capacity. Number of beds available for COVID-19 treatment is likely much lower.
Number of icu icmus available in health: Number of ICU/ICMUs available in health care system. Presets are rough estimates indicating total capacity. Number of ICU/ICMUs available for COVID-19 treatment is likely much lower.
Number of people served by health care s: Number of people served by health care system.
Parameters of the population in the heal: Parameters of the population in the health care system.
Results disclaimer: This output of a mathematical model depends on model assumptions and parameter choices. We have done our best (in limited time) to check the model implementation is correct. Please carefully consider the parameters you choose and interpret the output with caution
Select region for which to plot confirme: Select region for which to plot confirmed case and death counts.
Start and end date of the simulation cha: Start and end date of the simulation. Changing the time range might affect the result due to resampling of the mitigation curve.
This tool was developed at the universit: This tool was developed at the University of Basel in the
Time from infection to onset of symptoms: Time from infection to onset of symptoms (here onset of infectiousness)
Time of the year with peak transmission: Time of the year with peak transmission
Toggle between logarithmic and linear sc: Toggle between logarithmic and linear scale on vertical axis of the plot
at the karolinska hospital in stockholm: at the Karolinska hospital in Stockholm had the initial idea to develop this tool and suggested features and parameters.
ooops this page does not exist: Ooops! This page does not exist
reduction of transmission through mitiga: Reduction of transmission through mitigation measures over time. Different presets with variable degree of reduction can be selected from the dropdown.
this table summarizes assumptions: This table summarizes the assumptions on severity which are informed by epidemiological and clinical observations in China. The first column reflects our assumption on what fraction of infections are reflected in the statistics from China, the following columns contain the assumption on what fraction of the previous category deteriorates to the next. These fields are editable and can be adjusted to different assumptions. The last column is the implied infection fatality for different age groups.
too many stochastic trajectories will sl: too many stochastic trajectories will slow things down
